title: Who truly likes this game?
body: Judging from all of these posts here, I see nothing but negativity. I feel like i'm one of the very few who just accept that the game is what it is honestly. All the toxicity, balancing, and ect, I have just came to accept that its just part of the game that I gotta deal with and if I dont like it, I always have the option to quit. Call me weird, but I still find league very fun and exciting to play, and I'm not trolling, I legit mean that (just look at my lvl if you dont believe me lol). Is there anyone else here who actually does not mind the bullshit and just looks past it and takes it for what it is?

replies.body:
People complain because they care. It hurts seeing something you love straying increasingly further away from the form it had when you fell for it.

Personally, I care about League, but I don't know if I can say I love it in it's current state. For sure though, I don't like Riot.
This.
Bethesda>Blizzard>Riot>ISIS>EA

When I first started playing League of Legends, I couldn't put it down. You know how people talk about their grades slipping because of that new thing they found that they love? This was that. I was sleeping in class in high school because I was staying up all night to play League with friends who had just gotten into it like me.

I would rage, and I would laugh, and I would complain, and I would praise. I was passionate about the game. I was in love with it.

But like most things, time dulled my love for it. Compounded by many changes to the game that felt really bad, I fell out of love with it hard. Keep in mind that I still hardcore smashed League of Legends like fucking liquor for 5 years before I finally started to slow down. And even when I slowed down, I was still playing at least a few hours each day. But then my friends started to stop playing entirely. Each time a friend would stop, the game became that much more lackluster for me. 

It took me 6 years of League to realize that League was never the treasure. It was (and I'm saying this 100% not ironically) the friends I made along the way, and the memories we created.

It's clearly not the same game I used to play 3-4 years ago.

Modern champs are utterly overpowered and given with such lame kits.

Reworks are nightmarish to balance except few. Either they gut them to unplayable or overbuffing to monstrosity.

Towers getting 2 tapped, too much cc in the game (I wish they introduced diminishing return) because I am tired getting perma cc'd to death.
This is so on point. Champions now have like 10 passives, dashes, cc plus some new buff. And are going to be extremely overpowered or nothing, like qiyana.
What is "Diminishing Return"?

It's from other game but just to clarify it's meaning.

https://wow.gamepedia.com/Diminishing_returns

You have to remember that as much as this place wants to think and act like it makes of the majority of the playerbase, it doesn't even make a fraction of a fraction of it. Also, people who are happy don't complain, you don't see post about people saying "Man, I sure do love this game." that doesn't normally happen and that is all video games.

I very much still enjoy League.  Yes, there's been changes I don't agree with(The mage item rework a couple seasons ago being the biggest one), but the game as a whole is still the same game I've always loved.

The problem is that the players who dislike the game are an EXTREMELY vocal minority.  The majority of us who are enjoying the game are out there actually enjoying it - They have no reason to seek out the boards or Reddit like those who are complaining do.  Queue times are the same(Or close enough) now(For me, at least.) as they have been for the last 5 years, yet the boards would have you thinking the game has fallen off a cliff.  Clearly there's still plenty of us enjoying it if queues aren't increasing across the board.
